intro: Dasycondylus hirsutissimus, commonly known as the hairy false heather, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its leaves are often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its common name. Dasycondylus hirsutissimus thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
